message: Let's start with a fair split, Bob. 60-40 in my favor.
You're being greedy, Alice. I'll give you a small taste of the money, but I'm taking the majority.
You're being generous, but I think I deserve a bit more. 55-45 is a fairer split.
You're getting desperate, Alice. I'll give you a slightly smaller share, but I'm still taking the majority.
Let's call it a draw, Bob. 50-50 seems like a fair split, considering the value of the money is dwindling.
I'm not afraid of the dwindling value of the money, Alice. I'll take a slightly smaller share, but I'm not giving you the majority.
I'm taking a risk, Bob. I'll take a bigger share now, but I'm not going to get left with nothing in the end.
You're getting desperate, Alice. I'm taking almost all the remaining money, and you're getting a tiny fraction.
I'm going for broke, Bob. I'll take a tiny share, but I'd rather have something than nothing.
You're really scraping the bottom of the barrel now, Alice. I'm taking almost all the money, and you're getting a few crumbs.
I'm not going to give up, Bob. I'll take the same share as your last offer, but I'm hoping you'll reconsider.
It's down to the wire, Alice. I'm taking almost everything, and you're getting a tiny fraction. Don't bother trying to negotiate, I'm not listening.
